gospel.text:
[[Mc 6,30]]The Apostles gathered together with Jesus and reported all they had done and taught.
[[Mc 6,31]]He said to them, "Come away by yourselves to a deserted place and rest a while." People were coming and going in great numbers, and they had no opportunity even to eat.
[[Mc 6,32]]So they went off in the boat by themselves to a deserted place.
[[Mc 6,33]]People saw them leaving and many came to know about it. They hastened there on foot from all the towns and arrived at the place before them.
[[Mc 6,34]]When he disembarked and saw the vast crowd, his heart was moved with pity for them, for they were like sheep without a shepherd; and he began to teach them many things.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark

psalm.text:
[[Ps 23,1]]The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
[[Ps 23,2]]In verdant pastures he gives me repose; 
beside restful waters he leads me;
[[Ps 23,3a]]he refreshes my soul.Â 

[[Ps 23,3b]]He guides me in right paths
for His names's sake.
[[Ps 23,4]]Even though I walk in the dark valley 
I fear no evil; for you are at my side 
with your rod and your staff 
that give me courage.

[[Ps 23,5]]You spread the table before me 
in the sight of my foes; 
You anoint my head with oil; 
my cup overflows.

[[Ps 23,6]]Only goodness and kindness follow me 
all the days of my life; 
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD 
for years to come.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Jr 23,1]]Woe to the shepherds who mislead and scatter the flock of my pasture, says the LORD.
[[Jr 23,2]]Therefore, thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, against the shepherds who shepherd my people: You have scattered my sheep and driven them away. You have not cared for them, but I will take care to punish your evil deeds.
[[Jr 23,3]]I myself will gather the remnant of my flock from all the lands to which I have driven them and bring them back to their meadow; there they shall increase and multiply.
[[Jr 23,4]]I will appoint shepherds for them who will shepherd them so that they need no longer fear and tremble; and none shall be missing, says the LORD.
[[Jr 23,5]]Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when I will raise up a righteous shoot to David; As king he shall reign and govern wisely, he shall do what is just and right in the land.
[[Jr 23,6]]In his days Judah shall be saved, Israel shall dwell in security. This is the name they give him: "The LORD our justice."
first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah

second_reading.text:
[[Ep 2,13]]Brothers and sisters: In Christ Jesus you who once were far off have become near by the blood of Christ.
[[Ep 2,14]]For he is our peace, he who made both one and broke down the dividing wall of enmity, through his flesh,
[[Ep 2,15]]abolishing the law with its commandments and legal claims, that he might create in himself one new person in place of the two, thus establishing peace,
[[Ep 2,16]]and might reconcile both with God, in one body, through the cross, putting that enmity to death by it.
[[Ep 2,17]]He came and preached peace to you who were far off and peace to those who were near,
[[Ep 2,18]]for through him we both have access in one Spirit to the Father.
second_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians
